PM Modi was born into a poor family and he became the PM of the world's largest democracy... 15 different nations gave their highest honour to him... 140 crore Indians are praying for his long life today," Amit Shah said while speaking on the 'Sewa Pakhwada' drive.Union defence minister Rajnath Singh, while wishing PM Modi on his birthday, called him the "successful Prime Minister of India"."Many congratulations and best wishes to the successful Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi, on his birthday. Not only India but the whole world has seen and experienced his farsighted and strong leadership. Modiji has led the country with full readiness, concentration and asceticism and is still doing so," wrote Rajnath Singh on X.BJP chief JP Nadda praised PM Modi's leadership as an "inspiration for millions of BJP workers"."I extend my heartiest congratulations on his birthday to respected Shri Narendra Modi ji, the successful Prime Minister, who is dedicated every moment to realizing the mantra of 'Antyodaya', dedicated to the service of the nation and the upliftment of the people," the BJP chief wrote.Tripura CM Manik Saha also wished PM Modi on his birthday, calling him the "great son of Maa Bharati"."Your vision for a stronger, prosperous India resonates in every heart. May your dynamic leadership & unwavering dedication continue to transform India and inspire generations!" Saha said.Maharashtra chief minister Eknath Shinde also extended birthday greetings to PM Modi, wishing him "good health and long life"."Under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi, India is moving towards becoming an economic superpower , I wish him the strength to fulfill his resolve of a developed India by 2047. Maharashtra is also making every possible effort to fulfill Prime Minister Modi's resolve of making the country a 5 trillion economy. I want to say that the 21st century is India's century because the captain of the country is Prime Minister Modi. I wish him a very happy birthday," CM Shinde said.Congress party chief Mallikarjun Kharge extended birthday wishes to PM Modi, wishing him "good health and long life"."Best wishes to Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi Ji on his birthday. May he be blessed with good health and long life," wrote Mallikarjun Kharge on X.Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal also wished PM Modi on his birthday."Heartiest wishes to the Honorable Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi ji on his birthday. I wish you a long and healthy life," Kejriwal wrote on X.On his 74th birthday, PM Modi will be in Odisha to launch a slew of projects, including 26 lakh PM Awas houses at Gadakana in Bhubaneswar and Subhadra Yojna.According to Police Commissioner Bhubaneswar Sanjeev Panda, after arriving at Bhubaneswar airport, PM Modi will proceed to the Gadakana slum area near Sainik School of Bhubaneswar.During his visit to the slum, PM Modi is scheduled to interact with the PM Awas beneficiaries.Subhadra Yojana, which aims to provide financial assistance to at least one crore women, will be launched by PM Modi at Janta Maidan.Each beneficiary of the scheme will receive Rs 50,000 over five years, with Rs 10,000 distributed in two instalments annually.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi turned 74 on Tuesday. President Droupadi Murmu extended her heartfelt wishes to PM Modi. PM Modi will be in Odisha to launch a slew of projects, including 26 lakh PM Awas houses at Gadakana in Bhubaneswar.

Article Title: PM Modi flags off six Vande Bharat trains in Jharkhand; check routes, schedule
Article Text:
Vande Bharat trains to enhance connectivity on these routes

PM Modi bows to Baba Baidyanath

I congratulate people on new Vande Bharat trains, says PM Modi

Now the priority is poor, STs, Dalits, women, youth, and farmers, says PM

Route and schedule

Tatanagar-Patna Vande Bharat Express:

Deoghar-Varanasi route:

Tatanagar-Berhampur:

Bhagalpur - Dumka - Howrah:

Gaya - Howrah:

Rourkela-Howrah Vande Bharat:

Vande Bharat trains to boost travel, tourism, and industry

PM also lays foundation stone of various projects

NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi virtually flagged off six new Vande Bharat trains on Sunday from Tatanagar in Jharkhand , expanding the Indian Railways fleet.These trains will enhance connectivity on various routes, including Tatanagar - Patna, Bhagalpur - Dumka - Howrah, Brahmapur - Tatanagar, Gaya - Howrah, Deoghar -Varanasi, and Rourkela - Howrah.PM Modi, while addressing the gathering via video conferencing, paid his respects to Baba Baidyanath, Baba Basukinath, and the land of Birsa Munda. He recounted his arrival at the Ranchi airport, where a lady welcomed him by offering a 'jawa' on 'Karma Parv', a festival during which sisters pray for their brother's well-being."I bow down to Baba Baidyanath and Baba Basukinath, the land of Birsa Munda. In the morning, when I reached at the Ranchi airport, a lady welcomed me by offering me a 'jawa' on 'Karma Parv'. During this festival, the sisters pray for the well-being of their brothers. Jharkhand has got the blessings of development today, six Vande Bharat trains were flagged off, and lakhs of people will be getting pucca houses," the Prime Minister said.The Prime Minister emphasised that Jharkhand has been blessed with development, as evidenced by the flagging off of six Vande Bharat trains and the provision of pucca houses to lakhs of people.PM Modi highlighted the significance of the day in Jharkhand's developmental journey, with the state receiving six new Vande Bharat trains, railway projects worth over Rs 650 crores, improved connectivity and travel infrastructure, and thousands of people receiving their own homes under the PM Awas Yojana. He congratulated the people of Jharkhand on these remarkable development initiatives and the new Vande Bharat trains."Today, the state has been provided with six new Vande Bharat trains, railway projects worth over Rs 650 crores, enhanced connectivity and travel infrastructure, and the added benefit of thousands of people receiving their own homes under the PM Awas Yojana. I extend my heartiest congratulations to the people of Jharkhand for these remarkable development initiatives. I congratulate people on new Vande Bharat trains," he added.The Prime Minister stressed that the central government's priority is the development of tribals, the poor, youth, and women."There was a time when development used to be confined to few areas. Jharkhand was a laggard. But Sabka Saath Sabka Vikas has changed everything. Now the priority is poor, STs, Dalits, women, youth, and farmers, hence, Jharkhand is getting the Vande Bharat Trains, modern infrastructure. I flagged off the trains. It will help the economy in eastern region. PM Janman Yojana is being run for the tribal brothers and sisters across the country. Through this scheme, efforts are being made to reach those tribes who are very backward. The budget for railway development for Jharkhand is Rs. 7,000 crores. If we compare this to the budget 10 years ago, it is 16 times more," he said.PM Modi also mentioned that under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme, more than 50 railway stations in Jharkhand are being renovated."Today, Jharkhand has also joined the list of states where 100 per cent electrification of the railway network has been achieved. Under the Amrit Bharat Station Yojana, over 50 railway stations in Jharkhand are also being transformed. Today, the first instalment has been released for the construction of permanent houses for thousands of beneficiaries in Jharkhand under the PM Awas Yojana," PM Modi addded.The Vande Bharat Express connecting Tatanagar and Patna is set to commence its operations, running six days a week. The train is expected to cover the distance between the two cities in approximately seven hours. Departing from Tatanagar at 6 am the train will reach its destination, Patna, at 3 pm. For the return journey, the train will leave Patna at 3 p.m. and arrive back in Tatanagar at 11 pm.The newly introduced Vande Bharat Express will connect Deoghar and Varanasi. The train will traverse through the state of Bihar, following the Kiul-Gaya route, and will include a designated stop at Nawada station. The Varanasi-Deoghar Vande Bharat Express is set to run on a six-day schedule, providing service every day except for Tuesdays.The newly introduced Vande Bharat Express will run on a schedule of six days per week, with Tuesdays being the only day of non-operation. With this addition, Odisha now boasts a total of four Vande Bharat Express trains.The railway project will link together three states; Bihar, Jharkhand, and West Bengal.The Howrah-Gaya Vande Bharat Express is set to commence its regular service on September 18, running six days a week, with Thursday being the exception. The train will traverse a distance of 458 km (285 miles) between Howrah and Gaya, completing the journey in 5 hours and 40 minutes.The newly introduced train service will make just three stops during its journey from the starting point to the final destination. The route will include passing through the stations of Chakradharpur, Tatanagar, and Kharagpur. The first special train is scheduled to leave Rourkela at 11 am and is expected to arrive at Howrah station at 6.15 pm.The introduction of these Vande Bharat Express trains is expected to benefit various segments of society, including regular travellers, professionals, businesses, and students.Moreover, these trains will boost religious tourism in the region by providing faster access to pilgrimage sites such as Baidyanath Dham in Deoghar, Kashi Vishwanath temple in Varanasi, and Kalighat and Belur Math in Kolkata. Industries such as coal mines in Dhanbad, jute in Kolkata, and iron and steel in Durgapur will also benefit from the improved connectivity.In addition to the train flagging off, PM Modi laid the foundation stone and dedicated various railway projects worth more than Rs 660 crores to the nation.The Indian Railways currently operates over 50 Vande Bharat Express trains, connecting states with Broad Gauge (B G) electrified networks.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi virtually flagged off six new Vande Bharat trains on Sunday from Tatanagar in Jharkhand. The trains will enhance connectivity on various routes, including Tatangar - Patna, Bhagalpur - Dumka - Howrah, Brahmapur - Tatanagar, Gaya - Howhra, Deoghar -Varanasi, and Rourkela - HowRah.

Article Title: 'This reel disease is increasing': UP man arrested for faking death on busy road
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Tension gripped the Kasganj district of Uttar Pradesh when a man's pursuit of online fame took an extreme turn. A video is doing rounds on social media , that captured a 23-year-old man, identified as Mukesh Kumar , lying still on a busy road in Kasganj, pretending to be dead.In the video, it can be seen that his 'lifeless' body was covered with a white bed sheet, cotton was stuffed in his nostrils, and a flower garland around his neck, creating a disturbingly realistic scene.However, as the video concluded, Kumar abruptly came to life, erupting in laughter. The astonished bystanders realised they had been tricked into witnessing an elaborate prank and promptly notified the authorities.Consequently, local police arrested Kumar for causing public disturbance and mischief. The video, shared on X, was captioned, ''In #UttarPradesh's Kasganj district, a young man pretended to die by lying down in the middle of a busy intersection. The police have arrested the ' reel star ' Mukesh Kumar."According to Shri Rajesh Bharti, additional superintendent of police, the incident took place at the Raj Cold Storagearea in Kasganj, Uttar Pradesh. In a video statement, he said, ''The man has made a video by sleeping on the road and creating a shock through his video. Taking cognisance of this, we have arrested the man identified as Mukesh Kumar and necessary action will follow."The stunt video has triggered widespread criticism from social media users, who condemned Kumar for his insensitive and attention-seeking behaviour. His reckless attempt at going viral has provoked outrage and raised concerns about the perils of social media obsession.One user commented, ''Reel makers are ready to go to any extent,'' while another remarked, ''I never thought people would stoop so low for views.'' A third user wrote, ''The world is full of strange and crazy people, they should be given training to make good reels.'' Another added, ''This reel disease is increasing.''
Article Summary: A video is doing rounds on social media that captured a 23-year-old man, identified as Mukesh Kumar, lying still on a busy road in Kasganj, Uttar Pradesh. In the video, it can be seen that his 'lifeless' body was covered with a white bed sheet, cotton was stuffed in his nostrils, and a flower garland around his neck.

Article Title: '​​​​Too much hate': US lawmakers react to vandalism at BAPS Swaminarayan Mandir in New York
Article Text: NEW DEHLI: United States Congress leaders on Tuesday squarely criticised the vandalism at BAPS Swaminarayan Mandir in New York's Melville , calling it acts of " bigotry and hate" which is happening because of "inflammatory rhetoric by national leaders".Condemning the act that drew sharp reactions from various quarters, the US leaders demanded that the act should be probed as a "hate crime" and accountability should be fixed to ensure such incidents don't repeat."There is too much hate! I am appalled by the hideous acts of vandalism targeting the BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Melville. Such acts of vandalism, bigotry, and hate are happening far too often because of inflammatory rhetoric by national leaders, extremism , and lack of accountability. Acts like these are un-American and contradict the core values of our nation," wrote US Congressman Tom Suozzi.Another US Congressman, Ro Khanna strongly condemned the desecration of the temple, saying "Freedom of worship is a bedrock of our democracy. There is no place for acts of intimidation, harassment or violence". Khanna also sought accountability to avert a similar incident in the future.Jenifer Rajkumar, New York State Assemblywoman, called for the investigation while stating that "freedom of worship is a fundamental American value that we must protect"."I condemn the vandalism of the BAPS Hindu Temple, a beacon of spirituality & inclusivity that is beloved in the community. I call for this to be investigated as a hate crime. Freedom of worship is a fundamental American value that we must protect," said Jenifer Rajkumar.The BAPS Swaminarayan Temple in New York's Melville was vandalised on Monday.The Indian consulate in New York expressed strong disapproval of the act, labelling it "unacceptable."The incident took place in Melville, Suffolk County, around 28 kilometers from the Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to address a large community event at this venue on September 22.After the incident, BAPS issued a statement and claimed the act was "aimed at inciting hatred against Hindus"."Deeply saddened by the desecration of our BAPS Mandir in Melville, NY, an act aimed at inciting hatred against Hindus. Today, local, state & federal leaders gathered to promote peace, respect & unity. Guided by our faith, we stand united against hate with compassion & solidarity," BAPS Public Affairs wrote on X.
Article Summary: The BAPS Swaminarayan Temple in New York's Melville was vandalised on Monday. US leaders demanded that the act should be probed as a "hate crime" and accountability should be fixed. BAPS issued a statement and claimed the act was "aimed at inciting hatred against Hindus"
